intro: Trachyrhachis thersites, commonly known as the narrow-leaved grass. It is a member of the Poaceae family, characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and spikelet-based inflorescence. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its morphology includes a slender stem with alternate, linear leaves. Trachyrhachis thersites is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
